meanings: markedly different from an accepted norm
usages: When the financial director started screaming and throwing food at his co-workers, the police had to come in to deal with his aberrant behavior.

meanings: a deviation from what is normal or expected
usages: Aberrations in climate have become the norm, rarely a week goes by without some meteorological phenomenon making headlines.

meanings: choose not to consume or take part in (particularly something enjoyable)
usages: Considered a health nut, Jessica abstained from anything containing sugar--even chocolate .
Physics textbooks can seem so abstruse to the uninitiated that readers feel as though they are looking at hieroglyphics.

meanings: an award or praise granted as a special honor
usages: Jean Paul-Sartre was not a fan of accolades, and as such, he refused to accept the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1964 .
Most movie critics are acerbic towards summer blockbusters, often referring to them as garbage .
The acrimonious dispute between the president and vice-president sent a clear signal to voters, the health of the current administration was imperiled.
